content.description:
Short but surprisingly sustained/pumpy route. 

  Start with a tricky traverse right into good underclings but delicate feet. Then move upwards into some flakes and get a semi-rest in the sudepulls/underclings of a beautiful arch. The starting traverse and the final crimps are difficult, but the crux for most is finding good feet and making a big move out of the undercling arch to a crimp. Gave it a PG13 because the cruxy sections are on delicate feet and most falls occur as a result of slipping feet and are not so controlled. Depending on your beta there is a possibility to swing into or hit the platform to the right.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Shares chains with Mona, starts 6 feet left of the platform in the corner.

content.description: This climb has fun technical moves that takes a bit o' strategy. The finish is the hardest section so try to conserve your energy. You'll find a good rest half way up while "straddling" the climb.
content.location: Mid section of the formation starts in a left leaning crack. If you look at the top of the climb you'll see a dinosaur shape that's fairly prominent...a brontosaurus shape to be exact. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're or rappelling only.

content.description: This climb is overhanging with powerful moves. Very popular cause it's one of the best climbs at Sneed's Cory.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a bolted rap anchor.
content.location: To the right of Paws for Thought you'll see a chalked up climb with bolts going straight up an overhanging section. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: Easiest climb in Sneed's with bomber holds. Good to start on for beginners.
content.location: Middle of the formation with a noticeably easy angle and jugs the whole way up. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: Climb goes into a dihedral section of rock and then goes to good crimps to finish it out.
content.location: Next sport climb to the right of Pop. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: Crux is mid way up this technical climb. Lots of fun movements with good holds.
content.location: Vertical sport lead to the right of Mean People Suck. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: The climb has fun obstacles with huge features. From the fourth bolt you can finish straight up or bail off left.
content.protection: 4 bolts with a gear anchor up top.
content.location: First climb on this formation starting from the left. The decent for this climb is an easy walk off to the left of the rock

content.description: Stay to the right and lie-back the arete past 2 bolts. After the bolts climb the jugs to the anchor. It gets easy after the bolts but don't fall cause you'll be hurtin.
content.location: Right side of the formation you'll see the obvious arete with two bolts on face to the left. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: This climb has good solid crimps and intermediate holds all the way to the top.
content.location: Start but move out left to the face where the dihedral begins on the right side of Sneed's. It's in between Holiday and a good 5.12 to the left called Terra-Tex. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: The crux is midway up the climb with a mellow finish. The moves on this climb are fun and solid.
content.location: To the right of Star Fighter you'll see bolts that go right to left coming about 2ft within Star Fighter. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: Decent mixed lead climb that needs only 2 pieces of gear. Use the same anchor as Mona to TR.
content.location: Right side of the formation there's a dihedral that goes left up top to link with the last bolt on Mona. It's to the left of the obvious arete climb called The Nook. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: Climb up and right through a fun section between a couple of rocks up top. Another good beginner lead.
content.location: Mid formation to the right of Spirit and to the left of Straddler. Rap chains up top, however DO NOT belay off the chains...they're for rappelling only.

content.description: Start to the left of spirit. Ascend climbers left of dihedral using positive and small holds. Gear anchor to be built at top
content.protection: Trad gear up to 3”, you’ll have to build an anchor
content.location: To the left of spirit. No bolts.

content.description: Easy start to a reachy sequence some 10 feet above ground. Cruxy for some other 15 feet, fun and challenging to an easy finish
content.protection: Three bolts, two anchors shared with Star Fighter
content.location: Right of Star fighter, rappel off of anchors

content.description: The climbing is shaded till about 11am and the rock itself is full of features with fun climbs along the wall. This area does however get crowded on the weekends. The climbs are short but full of fun moves. The majority of the climbs are sport aside from a coulpe climbs that take gear.
